data.title: Is It Wordlike?
data.solution:
# Vowels are aeiouy
# Author: SteepBack13

n = gets.to_i
C = /[^aeiouy]/
V = /[aeiouy]/

n.times do
  possible_word = gets.chomp
  
  v_count = possible_word.scan(V).size
  triples = possible_word.scan(/(.)\1\1/)
  five_v = possible_word[/#{V}{5}/]
  seven_c = possible_word[/#{C}{7}/]
  wordlike = v_count > 0 && triples.size == 0 && !five_v && !seven_c

  puts "#{possible_word} is #{ wordlike ? 'wordlike' : 'not wordlike' }"
end
data.statement:
You are learning English and have encountered some simple rules for distinguishing whether a string of English letters is {{wordlike}}. Given a list of [[n]] such [[possible_words]], print whether they are {{wordlike}} or {{not wordlike}}, using the following rules:

1. No triple letters. (e.g. "questttion" is {{not wordlike}})
2. Words must have at least 1 vowel. (e.g. "tsk" is {{not wordlike}})
3. Words must have no more than 4 consecutive vowels. (e.g. "booiying" is {{not wordlike}})
4. Words must have no more than 6 consecutive consonants (e.g. "schrthrong" is {{not wordlike}})

If all four rules are obeyed, then consider the string {{wordlike}}.

<<Note:>> vowels are considered to be {{aeiouy}} and consonants are all other letters.

testCases.title: 2: y & Triple
testCases.testOut:
syzygy is wordlike
amerikkkan is not wordlike

testCases.title: Validator 2
testCases.testOut:
coooperative is not wordlike
rhythm is wordlike

testCases.title: 3: Min. Vowel Check
testCases.testOut:
sky is wordlike
tbh is not wordlike
scrtch is not wordlike
a is wordlike

testCases.title: Validator 3
testCases.testOut:
tsktsk is not wordlike
fly is wordlike
i is wordlike
wwjd is not wordlike

testCases.title: 4: Max Vowel Check
testCases.testIn:
6
boo
booing
queue
queueing
onomatopoeia
onomatopoeiaing
testCases.testOut:
boo is wordlike
booing is wordlike
queue is wordlike
queueing is not wordlike
onomatopoeia is wordlike
onomatopoeiaing is not wordlike

testCases.title: Validator 4
testCases.testIn:
6
tuulueis
fyuyuorore
rousseauism
yoyoing
hibernate
hashtag
testCases.testOut:
tuulueis is wordlike
fyuyuorore is not wordlike
rousseauism is wordlike
yoyoing is not wordlike
hibernate is wordlike
hashtag is wordlike

testCases.title: 5: Max Consonant Check
testCases.testIn:
10
catchphrase
archchronicler
latchstring
hirschsprung
tsktsks
syzygys
belllike
frooomes
owwjdnthcb
wymynctmpt
testCases.testOut:
catchphrase is wordlike
archchronicler is wordlike
latchstring is wordlike
hirschsprung is not wordlike
tsktsks is not wordlike
syzygys is wordlike
belllike is not wordlike
frooomes is not wordlike
owwjdnthcb is not wordlike
wymynctmpt is wordlike

testCases.title: Validator 5
testCases.testIn:
10
eschscholtzia
schtschurowskia
lengthsman
postphthisic
crosssection
frnglyths
frnnggllyths
bbrrmmss
ymmrrddoop
sequoiainggrrmms
testCases.testOut:
eschscholtzia is wordlike
schtschurowskia is not wordlike
lengthsman is wordlike
postphthisic is wordlike
crosssection is not wordlike
frnglyths is wordlike
frnnggllyths is not wordlike
bbrrmmss is not wordlike
ymmrrddoop is wordlike
sequoiainggrrmms is not wordlike

data.constraints:
1 ≤ [[n]] ≤ 10
[[possible_words]] will only contain English lowercase letters ({{a-z}})
data.stubGenerator:
read n:int
loop n read possibleWord:string(20)
loop n write possible_word is (not )wordlike

STATEMENT
Vowels are aeiouy
Author: StepBack13
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> an integer [[n]]
<<Next [[n]] lines:>> a [[possible_word]], composed of lowercase letters: {{a-z}}
data.outputDescription: <<[[n]] lines:>> Either: [[possible_word]] {{is wordlike}} or [[possible_word]] {{is not wordlike}}, corresponding to how each [[possible_word]] obeys the 4 rules

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You are learning English and have encountered some simple rules for distinguishing whether a string of English letters is wordlike. Given a list of n such possible_words, print whether they are wordlike or not wordlike, using the following rules:

1. No triple letters. (e.g. "questttion" is not wordlike)
2. Words must have at least 1 vowel. (e.g. "tsk" is not wordlike)
3. Words must have no more than 4 consecutive vowels. (e.g. "booiying" is not wordlike)
4. Words must have no more than 6 consecutive consonants (e.g. "schrthrong" is not wordlike)

If all four rules are obeyed, then consider the string wordlike.

Note: vowels are considered to be aeiouy and consonants are all other letters.
Input
Line 1: an integer n
Next n lines: a possible_word, composed of lowercase letters: a-z
Output
n lines: Either: possible_word is wordlike or possible_word is not wordlike, corresponding to how each possible_word obeys the 4 rules
Constraints
1 ≤ n ≤ 10
possible_words will only contain English lowercase letters (a-z)
Example
Input
1
word
Output
word is wordlike
